title: Persuasive Design of Serious Games Using Procedural Rhetoric

context.prior_knowledge: Basic game design principles, understanding of argumentative structures, and experience in mathematical modeling
context.additional_context: Learners explore methods to convey social arguments by combining game mechanics with mathematical systems. Develop actual game prototypes via project-based assessment, integrating procedural rhetoric and ethos elements.

learning_goals: Learners can explain methods for arguing social issues through procedural systems in games
Learners can design game mechanics incorporating ethos elements (phronesis, arete, eunoia)
Learners can implement and evaluate persuasive game rules using mathematical modeling

resources: Case study materials (McDonald's Videogame, ReDistricting Game)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
